intro: Aster shortii var. monroei, commonly known as the Monroean aster, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
